name: Supta Baddha Konasana (Reclining Bound Angle Pose)
steps: Lie on your back, bend your knees, and bring the soles of your feet together.
Let your knees fall open to the sides.
Place your arms comfortably at your sides and relax.
precautions: Support knees with pillows if they strain your inner thighs.
Avoid if you have severe hip or groin injury.
benefits: Improves blood circulation in the pelvic region

name: Balasana (Child's Pose)
steps: Kneel down, sit on your heels, and stretch arms forward on the floor.
Lower your forehead to the mat and relax deeply.
Breathe slowly and deeply.
precautions: Avoid if pregnant or with severe knee issues.
Can place a pillow under the chest for more comfort.
benefits: Releases tension in the back and hips

name: Apanasana (Knees-to-Chest Pose)
steps: Lie on your back, hug both knees into your chest.
Hold your shins and gently rock side to side.
Keep breathing deeply.
precautions: Avoid if you have recent abdominal surgery.
Be gentle if suffering from spinal issues.

name: Viparita Karani (Legs-up-the-Wall Pose)
steps: Lie down and swing your legs up against the wall.
Keep your arms relaxed at your sides.
Focus on slow breathing.
precautions: Avoid if you have glaucoma or neck issues.
Support hips with a folded blanket if needed.

name: Setu Bandhasana (Bridge Pose)
steps: Lie on your back, bend your knees and place feet flat on the floor.
Lift your hips upward while pressing arms and shoulders into the floor.
Hold and breathe slowly.
precautions: Avoid if you have a neck or shoulder injury.
Don't turn your head while in the pose.

name: Marjaryasana-Bitilasana (Cat-Cow Pose)
steps: Start on all fours with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
Inhale, arch your back and lift your head and tailbone (Cow Pose).
Exhale, round your spine and tuck your chin (Cat Pose).
Repeat slowly several times, coordinating with your breath.
precautions: Avoid if you have severe wrist or spine injury.
Move gently if you have neck problems.

name: Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose)
steps: Lie face down with palms under shoulders.
Inhale, press palms and lift chest off the floor, keeping elbows slightly bent.
Look forward or slightly up.
Hold and breathe steadily.
precautions: Avoid if you have wrist, back or neck injuries.
benefits: Improves blood flow to pelvic area

name: Parivrtta Janu Sirsasana (Revolved Head-to-Knee Pose)
steps: Sit with one leg extended and the other bent with foot touching inner thigh.
Inhale, lengthen the spine.
Exhale, twist torso and reach toward the extended leg.
Hold and breathe deeply.
precautions: Avoid if you have spinal or hamstring injuries.

name: Uttanasana (Standing Forward Bend)
steps: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Exhale, bend forward at hips, letting your head hang.
Keep knees slightly bent if needed.
Relax your neck and shoulders.
precautions: Avoid if you have lower back or hamstring injury.
Do not bounce in the pose.
benefits: Relieves tension in the back and neck

name: Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward Facing Dog)
steps: Start on all fours, hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart.
Lift hips toward the ceiling to form an inverted V shape.
Press heels toward the floor and keep the spine straight.
Breathe evenly and hold.
precautions: Avoid if you have wrist, shoulder, or back injuries.
Modify with bent knees if hamstrings are tight.

name: Virabhadrasana II (Warrior II Pose)
steps: Stand with legs wide apart.
Turn one foot out 90 degrees, bend that knee.
Extend arms out to sides parallel to floor.
Gaze over front hand.

name: Utthita Trikonasana (Extended Triangle Pose)
steps: Stand with legs wide apart.
Turn one foot out and stretch arms parallel to floor.
Reach front hand down to shin/foot and other arm up.
Look up toward raised hand.

name: Parivrtta Trikonasana (Revolved Triangle Pose)
steps: From triangle pose, twist torso and reach opposite hand to outside of front foot.
Extend other arm upwards.
Keep spine long and breathe deeply.
precautions: Avoid if back or neck injury.

name: Ustrasana (Camel Pose)
steps: Kneel on the floor with knees hip-width apart.
Place hands on heels, arch back, lift chest.
Drop head back if comfortable.
Hold and breathe steadily.
precautions: Avoid if neck or back pain.

name: Ardha Matsyendrasana (Half Spinal Twist)
steps: Sit with legs extended.
Bend one knee and cross it over other leg.
Twist torso toward bent knee, place opposite arm outside knee.
Look over shoulder and breathe.

name: Savasana (Corpse Pose)
steps: Lie flat on back.
Keep legs and arms relaxed, palms up.
Close eyes and breathe naturally.
Relax completely.

name: Gomukhasana (Cow Face Pose)
steps: Sit cross-legged.
Stack knees, right on top of left.
Reach one arm over shoulder, other behind back to clasp hands.
Breathe steadily.

name: Parsvottanasana (Intense Side Stretch Pose)
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Step one foot back and turn it out slightly.
Fold forward over front leg with hands on floor or blocks.
Keep spine long.

name: Salamba Sarvangasana (Supported Shoulderstand)
steps: Lie on back.
Lift legs and hips off floor, support back with hands.
Keep body vertical on shoulders.
Hold and breathe steadily.
precautions: Avoid if neck or high blood pressure problems.

name: Virasana (Hero Pose)
steps: Kneel with knees together.
Sit back between heels.
Keep spine straight.
Breathe calmly.

name: Malasana (Garland Pose)
steps: Squat with feet close together.
Bring palms together in prayer position.
Press elbows against inner knees to open hips.
Keep back straight.

name: Bharadvajasana (Seated Twist)
steps: Sit with legs extended straight.
Bend knees and bring feet to the left of hips.
Place right hand behind back, left hand on right knee.
Twist torso to the right, looking over right shoulder.

name: Supta Virasana (Reclining Hero Pose)
steps: Start in Virasana (Hero Pose).
Place hands behind you, lean back onto forearms.
Lower back to floor, extend arms overhead.
Relax and breathe deeply.
precautions: Avoid if knee or back injury.
Use props if needed for support.

name: Janu Sirsasana (Head-to-Knee Pose)
steps: Sit with one leg extended, other bent with foot to inner thigh.
Inhale, lengthen spine.
Exhale, fold forward over extended leg.
Hold feet or ankles if possible.

name: Supta Padangusthasana (Reclining Hand-to-Big-Toe Pose)
steps: Lie on back, extend one leg up.
Hold big toe with hand or use strap.
Keep other leg straight on floor.
Breathe deeply and hold.

name: Ananda Balasana (Happy Baby Pose)
steps: Lie on back, bring knees to chest.
Grab outer edges of feet with hands.
Gently pull knees toward armpits.
Rock side to side if comfortable.

name: Matsyasana (Fish Pose)
steps: Lie on back, place hands under hips.
Press elbows into floor, lift chest.
Drop head back gently.
Breathe deeply.

name: Dhanurasana (Bow Pose)
steps: Lie on stomach, bend knees.
Reach back to hold ankles.
Lift chest and thighs off floor.
Rock gently if comfortable.
precautions: Avoid if back or neck injury.

name: Halasana (Plow Pose)
steps: Lie on back, lift legs overhead.
Support lower back with hands.
Lower feet behind head if possible.
Keep legs straight.

name: Paschimottanasana (Seated Forward Bend)
steps: Sit with legs extended straight.
Inhale, lengthen spine.
Exhale, fold forward from hips.
Hold feet or ankles if possible.
